scenes.text:
It is the simplest first test without choice
Some tip: each new branch of dialogues started with special index that should be placed in the editor "list of start ids"

Second dialogue triggered. 
Now i will tell u how it works

So, there are supposed to be a json file with all contents of dialogues for each object
 Every message has own parameters: id, text, selectionIds
id is responsible for uniqueness of messages. It is okay if different objects which have dialogues have matching ids, but they should be unique among a specific object
text - it is the simplest part of dialogue. Just text that u see right now

selectionIds - it is an array with all ids of scenes that can be after this message
If this array is empty then it is the end of current dialogue
If there is only one id it just switch u to next scene
If there are several ids it will give a choice
In case of choice, firstly, u will say that u have chose
U can use selectionIds in different ways. For example u can put [-1, id] to create a single button with next id = $id$

And last thing, this selection works on indexes, but it can be easily replaced by string or something, just replace list of scenes on dictonary of special type
That is the end
